trans-unit.source: Represents a complete, in-memory description of the service, including all the endpoints for the service and specifications for their respective addresses, bindings, contracts and behaviors.

The information contained in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription> is used by the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] system to building the run-time components for the service.
Use this method when adding custom behaviors to extend <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost>.

Programmatically, you must <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601.Add%28%600%29> the custom service behavior to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Behaviors%2A> prior to when you call the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.Open%2A> method on the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost> object.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.GetService%28System.Object%29> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.GetService%28System.Type%29> methods are available to reflect on behaviors using the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] programming model when replacing <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase> with you own hosting mechanism.

Export metadata about a service endpoint by passing <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> as a parameter to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.ExportEndpoint%28System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%29>.

After calling this method, or one of the other export methods provided by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter>, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.GeneratedWsdlDocuments%2A> property to return the collection of <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> objects.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> class from a specified enumeration of service endpoints.
The <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint"></xref> used to initialize the service description.
endpoints is `null`.
Gets the behaviors associated with the service.
Use this method when adding custom behaviors to extend <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost>.

Programmatically, you must <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601.Add%28%600%29> the custom service behavior to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Behaviors%2A> prior to when you call the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ICommunicationObject.Open%2A> method on the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost> object.
The type of behavior that is accessible from the description hierarchy is scoped to the specific level.
From the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription> the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IServiceBehavior> is accessible.

If you want access to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior> associated with an endpoint instead, you can obtain the endpoints for the service using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Endpoints%2A> property.

Then retrieve the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> from the collection with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpointCollection.Find%2A> method that employs the relevant search criteria, and call the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.Behaviors%2A> property to obtain the collection of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior> objects.

The <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.KeyedByTypeCollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.IServiceBehavior"></xref> that contains the behaviors associated with the service.
Gets or sets the name of the <`service`> configuration element.
This name is not coupled to our configuration model.
This is used by service host base to wire up the service.
The configuration name is a required string attribute for the [\<service\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/wcf/service.md) configuration element.
The name of the [\<service\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/wcf/service.md) configuration element used to configure the service.
Gets the collection of endpoints from the service description.

The endpoints in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpointCollection> returned by this method each contain the address, binding, contract, and behavior information required to communicate with the service.

To access this information, you must retrieve the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> from the collection with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpointCollection.Find%2A> method that employs the relevant search criteria.
Then the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> properties can be used to access the information.
For example, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription> is accessed by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.Contract%2A> property.

Export metadata about a service endpoint by passing <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> as a parameter to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.ExportEndpoint%28System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint%29>.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpointCollection"></xref> that contains the endpoints defined for the service.
Returns a service description initialized with a specified service object.

Use this method to reflect on behaviors using the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] programming model when replacing <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase> with you own hosting mechanism.

<xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.GetService%28System.Object%29> initializes the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Name%2A>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Namespace%2A>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.ConfigurationName%2A> properties, and ensures that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceBehaviorAttribute> is attached to the service and adds any relevant service behaviors to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Behaviors%2A>.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that implements the service.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> for the service object provided.
serviceImplementation is `null`.
Returns a service description initialized with a specified service type.

Use this method to reflect on behaviors using the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] programming model when replacing <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase> with you own hosting mechanism.

<xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.GetService%28System.Type%29> initializes the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Name%2A>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Namespace%2A>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.ConfigurationName%2A> properties, reflects on the type for any the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceBehaviorAttribute> objects and adds them to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Behaviors%2A>, and ensures that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceBehaviorAttribute> is attached to the service.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the service.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> for the service type provided.
serviceType is `null`.
Gets or sets the name of the service.
If the name is `null`, this property returns the name of the service type.
If service type is also `null`, it returns the default service name.

When exporting WSDL metadata, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Name%2A> maps to the Web Service Development Language (WSDL) <`service`> element local name part of the (qualified) `name` attribute.
The name of the service.
Gets or sets the namespace for the service.

When exporting WSDL metadata, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceDescription.Namespace%2A>maps to the Web Service Development Language (WSDL) <`service`> element namespace name part of the (qualified) `name` attribute.
The namespace for the service.
Gets the type of the service.
An instance of the <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that implements the service.
